00051 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00052 {
00053     int num_rules = 0, numparents = 0, rule_size = 10, display_data = 0, verbose = 0;
00054     long number_of_generations = 0;
00055 
00056     /* Check if the user gave any of the option arguments. */
00057     int c;
00058     /* The special significance of a colon as the first character of optstring
00059        makes getopt() consistent with the getopts utility. It allows an application
00060        to make a distinction between a missing argument and an incorrect option
00061        letter without having to examine the option letter. It is true that a
00062        missing argument can only be detected in one case, but that is a case that
00063        has to be considered.
00064 
00065        This description was obtained from
00066                      http://www.frech.ch/man/man3p/optopt.3p.html
00067        (Last Accessed July 15, 2007)                                                */
00068     while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, ":dhv")) != -1)
00069     {
00070         switch (c)
00071         {
00072             case 'd':
00073                 display_data = 1;
00074                 break;
00075             case 'v':
00076                 verbose = 1;
00077                 break;
00078             case 'h':
00079                 fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [-OPTION] [<#rules per L-System> <initial rule length> <#parents> <#generations>]\n", argv[0]);
00080                 fprintf(stderr, " -d \t Displays the actual population after each operation.\n");
00081                 fprintf(stderr, " -v \t Verbose mode. Displays each step this program takes.\n");
00082                 fprintf(stderr, " -h \t Displays this help and exits.\n");
00083                 return 1;
00084             case '?':
00085                 fprintf(stderr, "Ignoring unrecognized option: -%c\n", optopt);
00086         }
00087     }
00088 
00089 
00090     /* There must be four non-option arguments. */
00091     if ((argc - optind) < 4)
00092     {
00093         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Expected at least three arguments.\n");
00094         fprintf(stderr, "Usage: %s [-d] [-v] [<#rules per L-System> <initial rule length> <#parents> <#generations>]\n", argv[0]);
00095         fprintf(stderr, " -d \t To display the actual population after each operation.\n");
00096         fprintf(stderr, " -v \t Verbose mode. Displays each step this program takes.\n");
00097         return 1;
00098     }
00099     else
00100     {
00101         int index = optind;
00102         num_rules = (int)strtol(argv[index], NULL, 10);
00103         rule_size = (int)strtol(argv[index + 1], NULL, 10);
00104         numparents = (int)strtol(argv[index + 2], NULL, 10);
00105         number_of_generations = strtol(argv[index + 3], NULL, 10);
00106     }
00107 
00108 
00109     /* The variables needed for predicting the completion times. */
00110     time_t start_time = time (NULL), curtime, predict_finish, predict_nextpercent;
00111     double elapsedtime, time_interval;
00112     struct tm *predict_finish_tm, *predict_nextpercent_tm;
00113 
00114     long count = 0;
00115     int display_progress = 0;
00116 
00117     /* Find out when we will reach 10%, 20%, ..., 100% so that we can display
00118        them on the screen */
00119     char *percent_str[10];
00120     int percent_value[10];
00121     double percent_value_fitness[10];
00122     int i;
00123     for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00124         asprintf(&percent_str[i], "%i0%% complete", i+1);
00125         percent_value[i] = (int)((double)number_of_generations*((double)(i+1)/10));
00126         percent_value_fitness[i] = 0;
00127     }
00128 
00129 
00130     /* Let's begin. Create a random population to start with. */
00131     datatype *pop;
00132     if (verbose) { printf("Creating population..."); fflush(stdout); }
00133     createPopulation(&pop, numparents, num_rules, rule_size);
00134     if (verbose) { printf("done.\n"); }
00135 
00136     if (verbose) { printf("Assigning Random values..."); fflush(stdout); }
00137     assignRandomValues(pop);
00138     if (verbose) { printf("done.\n"); }
00139     if (display_data)
00140     {
00141         printf("Initial Population\n");
00142         printall(pop);
00143     }
00144 
00145     /* Sort the population so that we can find the best individuals to be parents. */
00146     sortpopulation(pop);
00147 
00148     while (++count <= number_of_generations)
00149     {
00150         /* Select the best individuals to be parents and generate the children. */
00151         if (verbose) { printf("Generating children..."); fflush(stdout); }
00152         generateChildren(pop);
00153         if (verbose) { printf("done.\n"); }
00154         if (display_data)
00155         {
00156             printf("Generated Children\n");
00157             printall(pop);
00158         }
00159 
00160         /* Mutate the resulting offspring. */
00161         if (verbose) { printf("Mutating children..."); fflush(stdout); }
00162         mutateChildren(pop);
00163         if (verbose) { printf("done.\n"); }
00164         if (display_data)
00165         {
00166             printf("Mutated Children\n");
00167             printall(pop);
00168         }
00169 
00170         /* Sort the population so that we can find the best individuals to be parents. */
00171         sortpopulation(pop);
00172 
00173         /* If we've progressed through a further 10% of the generations/iterations, display
00174            this information on screen. Also display how good (fit) is the best individual
00175            (datatype) so far.                                                               */
00176         if (count == percent_value[display_progress])
00177         {
00178             /* We'd like to know how the population improves. */
00179             percent_value_fitness[display_progress] = getfitness(pop, 0);
00180 
00181             /* Show the best datatype we've got so far. */
00182             printf("%s\n", percent_str[display_progress]);
00183             printbest(pop);
00184 
00185             /* Print out the predicted completion times. */
00186             curtime = time(NULL);
00187             elapsedtime = difftime(curtime, start_time);
00188             time_interval = (elapsedtime/(display_progress+1));
00189 
00190             predict_finish = start_time + time_interval*10;
00191             predict_finish_tm = localtime(&predict_finish);
00192             printf("Estimated finish time: %d:%02d:%02d\n",
00193                 predict_finish_tm->tm_hour,
00194                 predict_finish_tm->tm_min,
00195                 predict_finish_tm->tm_sec);
00196 
00197             if (display_progress < 9)
00198             {
00199                 predict_nextpercent = curtime + time_interval;
00200                 predict_nextpercent_tm = localtime(&predict_nextpercent);
00201                 printf("Estimated time when %s: %d:%02d:%02d\n\n\n",
00202                     percent_str[display_progress+1],
00203                     predict_nextpercent_tm->tm_hour,
00204                     predict_nextpercent_tm->tm_min,
00205                     predict_nextpercent_tm->tm_sec);
00206             }
00207             else
00208                 printf("\n\n\n");
00209

00212             if (display_progress%3 == 0)
00213             {
00214                 fprintf(progress_stm, "Renewing Population...");
00215                 renewpop(pop);
00216                 fprintf(progress_stm, "done.\n");
00217             }
00218             */
00219         }
00220     }
00221 
00222     /* Show the user the best individual we have found. */
00223     printf("Best individual Found:\n");
00224     printbest(pop);
00225 
00226     /* Save the whole population to files */
00227     /* First create the folder. */
00228     if (verbose) { printf("Constructing directory..."); fflush(stdout); }
00229     curtime = time(NULL);
00230     struct tm *localtm = localtime(&curtime);
00231     char str_time[13];
00232     int n = strftime(str_time, 13, "%d%m%y_%H%M", localtm);
00233     mkdir(str_time, S_IRWXU);
00234     if (verbose) { printf("done. Created ./%s/\n", str_time); }
00235 
00236     char *fname, *lsname;
00237 
00238     for (i = 0; i < pop->pop_size; i++)
00239     {
00240         if (verbose) { printf("Constructing filename..."); fflush(stdout); }
00241         asprintf(&fname, "./%s/%0.4f.ls", str_time, getfitness(pop, i));
00242         if (verbose) { printf("done.\n"); }
00243

00247             percent_value_fitness[0],

00261         savelstofile(pop, i, fname, lsname, extra_info);

00266     if (verbose) { printf("Deleting population from memory..."); fflush(stdout); }
